title: Sulli autopsy results released as police confirm no suspicion of homicide
text:
Sulli died on Monday (Picture: Jang Se-young/Newsis via AP)

The preliminary results of Sulli’s autopsy have been released.

The 25-year-old star, real name Choi Jin-ri, was found dead on Monday 14 October at her home in Seongnam.

An autopsy for Sulli was held from 9am until 11am (KST) on 16 October, with a spokesperson from Seongnam Sujeong Police confirming that there are no suspicions of homicide.

They said: ‘No suspicions of homicide, such as external forces or pressure, were discovered as a result of the preliminary autopsy.’

Drug and toxicology results have yet to be disclosed.

Police are working off the assumption that Sulli took her own life (Picture: EPA/YONHAP)

Police previously said that they were working off the assumption that Sulli took her own life.

A police official said: ‘Choi seemed to have lived alone in the house.

‘It seems that she took her own life but we are also looking into other possibilities.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

The former f(x) star was found dead at her home in Sujeong-gu, Seongnam in the Gyeonggi province of South Korea by her manager.

Sulli’s funeral will be private (Picture: Imagine China/REX )

Sulli’s manager had gone to Sulli’s home after he could not contact the star, with police later attending the scene.

The singer and actress previously spoke about her struggles with anxiety, opening up about her mental health in her 2018 reality star Jinri Store.

Sulli – real name Choi Jin-ri – said: ‘Social phobia, panic disorder…. I’ve had panic disorder ever since I was young.

‘There were times when close people… Some of my closest friends have left me. People hurt me, so everything fell apart. I didn’t feel like I had anyone on my side or anyone who could understand me. So that’s why I completely fell apart.’

Sulli, who debuted with f(x) in 2009, left the girlband on hiatus in July 2014, after struggling with the abuse and malicious comments she received online.

A fan memorial was held yesterday and continues today at Shinchon Severance Hospital, while Sulli’s family are keeping her funeral private.

description: Police do not suspect homicide in the death of former f(x) star Sulli.
